review_blob:
Pours a nice mahogany with a medium yellow-ish head.
The aroma is a nice pine hop with that rye character.
Big bold flavor.  Very nice.  Hop pine punch is strong, the malt is not too sweet, but maybe too mellow.
The rye is a nice twist.
Very nice beer.

Beer pours orange with a medium sized white head.
The aroma is not hoppy nor malty... I assume that is the heather.
It is mild in the aroma. 
The flavor is different... Not bad, just different.  It is mellow and earthy.
The beer has a bit of a sour character.
FInish is not quick.  
An ok beer.

Pours deep amber, a touch or opacity.  The head is a off white and a good size.  Aroma is caramelly sweet hops.  a touch of grape fruit, a touch of pine.  Good bodied beer.  Not overly heavy ... and not too light.  A good medium for the sharp hop and the high alcohol.  
That touch of pine and grapefruit start you off before the sweetness of the hops take over.
The finish is not quick.... but not what I would call lingering either.
I like it.

From trade.  Beer pours nice and black, with a small fast fading tan head.  the aroma is roasted malt... but no overly roasted.  I would have expected smoke/coffee/caramel/etc...  The malts smell sweat though.  This is pretty thin for an imperial stout.  The flavor is straight forward... This would better be classified as a stout than an imperial stout.  It is ok.

The Pour is deep mahogany, with little bubbles for a head.  The aroma is very malty.  The malt falvor is good, not too sweet, not too roasty.
The beer is light, and the hops are just a hint.  This is a very drinkable beer.

In a crooked River Sampler Pack from the holiday season. 
The beer pours orange hued with a about half inch of white-ish head. 
The aroma is like a sweet wine.  The pears, is realy what I smell the most. 
The beer is very light, sweet.  There is an almost sour note in there that makes the whole beer a beer I dont think I will look for in the future.
The flavor is simple, sweet, not much in the way of hops.  
Very fruity.

Pour is clean amber with a few bubbles moving through, and a small off white head.  The aroma is earthy and malty.  Smells like a sweet malt.  Taste is what the aroma promised.  Pretty straight forward, not a heavy beer.  The finish is a bit long for a beer of this body.  
An OK amber.

The pour is a orange hued almost clear poor with a very small ring of suds for a head.  the aroma is all floral hops, with sweet malts..  The beer is deep with the sweet malts.  the hops are a nice hlghlighting note.  The beer finishes farily quick for such a deep malt.
beer_name: Thirsty Dog 75th Anniversary West Point Pale Ale

review_blob:
nice deep mahogany our with a large creamy tan head.  The aroma is oily almost like a big Belgian.
The flavor is deep like belgian.  There are honey and clove hints through out.  Pretty good.  A  nice winter beer.

I shudder when I see that a beer is lapped in the spice/herb/veg category.
However, this is the best of that category that I can remember.
the pour is a nice amber, little to no white head.   
The aroma is malty sweet.  
This beer is best enjoyed on a cold winter day.
the finish is long and lingering.  the flavor is malty with the seasonal spices that one would expect-  Cinnamon, clove, nutmeg.

Cloudy orange pour.... That could have been due to not keeping it from the unfiltered components form settling.   The head is small and white.  The aroma is sharp hoppy pine.
the flavor is sharp and harsh pine hop.
the finish is not was sloppier then I would have liked.   A good beer, but not a session beer.

Pale orange pour with a small white head.  The Aroma is also very light, some hop, pine and a touch floral.  The taste is crisp and sharp, the finish is quick a very easy drinking beer.
The surprise with this beer was the nice malt tones.
beer_name: Sierra Nevada Beer Camp 008: Nuthin in Common

review_blob:
The last from the Labatt sampler pack.
The pour is more orange than red, the head is about a perfect finger though, with a orangeish tinge.  
The aroma is sweet caramel malts, the beer is thinner then the Brown ale, but has more linger finish than I had expected.   
The flavor is OK.  
An overall OK beer.

From a sampler pack.  The brown ale pours nice and brown, a medium tan head.  The aroma is nice sweet malts.  The flavor is exactly what the aroma promises.  The beer has a surprising amount of body.  the taste, lingers a bit, and a longer finish.   But a nice brown ale.

This was a sampler pack from Labatt, Seasonal... I guess.
I really like marzen beers in general.
This was a paler than expected orange with a small off white head. 
The flavor pretty malty, but a touch more bitter than sweet.  the beer is fairly light bodied, and crisp.
An ok Marzen.

Nice amber pour.  The head was small and white.
The aroma mild malt and pumpkin.
The flavor is very mild pumpkin.  Not much spice. 
Decent beer over all.  I nice seasonal.

For some reason this year I have felt the need to try Pumpkin beers.
I thought This would be a pumpkin beer.  
However, after tasting it, is a a good ale... with a little too much spice.  
The pour is cloudy amber, with a small whitish head.
the Aroma is sweat malt, clover and nutmeg.  
The beer lingers a bit on the pallate, and the flavor is pretty much over powered by the spices.  
An ok beer.

Nice orange hued copper pour.  The beer is not crystal clear.  Nice big frothy off white head.  I think this is my first wet hopped beer.  The hop aroma is nice and bold.  The hop does not seem as pine like or crisp as what Im used to with big hopped IPAs.  The beer flavor matches the aroma, the beer is medium bodies at least and the flavor is bold.  Very enjoyable.
beer_name: Sierra Nevada Harvest Wet Hop IPA - Northern Hemisphere

review_blob:
An expensive bomber to be sure....
The aroma is HUGH Hop.
The flavor is hoppy, not as citursy and pine like as I was expecting.

The Beer pours nice and orange with a a small off white head.  
The flavor is excellent... this is nice way to tell a newbie what hop flavor is.

It is good.
beer_name: Hoppin Frog Hop Dam Triple IPA

review_blob:
This was in a large sampler box at the local grocery.  
The Pour is nice and black, with a med head of tan bubbles.  The aroma is slighter than you would expect from a porter, there is a bit of malt... but not much of anything.  As a porter goes a it is abit on the thinner side.  The body could be beefed up.  The flavor is pretty much a straight roasted malt.  A prett good beer.

This is showing up in all the stores the past couple of weeks here in north eastern ohio.

From a bottle, the pour is nice orange with a smaller whiteish head....
I have to say, this is not a bad octoberfest... But to imagine what it is like start with a samuel adams o-fest.  Make a touch more bitter and a bit more of a nutmeg character.
BAM.  This is a good beer.

The last thing I had with Juniper was a green tea.... and I didnt care for it.
So my hopes were low for this beer camp beer.
But the beer pours almost pitch black with a medium frothy brown head.  The aroma is deep and malty.  The juniper flavor is present and nice.  There are pine overtone and a touch of of molasses for sweetness.  
Full bodied.  Very enjoyable!

A bottle from the summer sampler.
Beer pours hazy orange with small sudsy head.  
Aroma is sharp wheat with some clove overtones.  The flavor matches the aroma.  Sharp finish.
A good beer, not one of my favorite styles... But still enjoyable as a switch up.

The pour is a dark mahogany, with little to no small ring of bubbles for a head.  The aroma is very slight, might be I had it too cold to get a good aroma.  The beer is much lighter than I had expected.  The deep malts have apricot notes and yeasty overtones.  The higher alcohol is not noticeable... Again I may have had it too cold.  The finish is not syrupy and sticky.  That is a good thing in my book.  This is one of my new favourites in this category.

From a sampler pack.
Pour deep opaque mahogany.  Little to no bubbles to make a head.  
aroma is rich sweet caramel.
The rye is pronounced, which is nice to give fellow samplers an idea of what rye should taste like.
The beer is short, sweet and medium bodied.
An ok beer.  Pretty enjoyable.

This pours pitch black, a medium ring of nice brown small suds builds then fades fairly quickly.  The aroma is sweet, but not caramel sweet, this is different.  The aroma also has nice roast to it.  The flavour is touched with a pretty true to the aroma, the roast is bold, the touch of sweetness it out of place... But it is not bad due to a sour note that took me by surprise.  This is probably one of my favorite imps so far.

this pours a light cider color.  No head.  The aroma has the cider/odd smell that I have come to expect.  This is not overly carbonated, the apple flavor is nice and not over powering.  Im not a huge fan of hard ciders.. But this one is very nice.

Kolsch is not my favorite style of beer.  However, when introducing a friend to the family of beers, it is a favorite warm up.  They tend to be light, mild and easy to drink.  
I found the angry angel while in North Carolina in a grocery store.  
The pour was darker than I expect in a kolsch.  The head was medium white bubbles.  the aroma had a distinct sweet honey/fruity pebbles aroma.  The body was light, the beer was sweet, the honey definatly came through in the whole beer experience.
And OK beer.

Im not a huge fan of wheat beer... Nor fruit beer. 
Understanding that:
This pours semi cloudy light amber mostly yellow in hue, small white ring of bubbles for a head.  The aroma is strong raspberries.  the Beer is sweet, the raspberry flavor is strong.  The finish is long-ish.  It is OK.

Wow, I cant believe I have not rated this beer yet.  
Easily found in most stores, not rarely found tap.  
Nice bright golden hue in the pour, a nice medium white head.  The Aroma is hop and it associated citrus and pine.  The flavor is sharp, crisp and perfect for a hot day.  This is just a great beer.

I have had this on tap at the out-standing brewery and in bottle.  I recommend a trip to the brewery.
The pour is nice orange hued yellow.  A medium white head sits nicely on 
top.  The aroma is sharp sharp pine with mild floral notes.  The flavor is exactly what the aroma promises.  big hop flavor, with sharp pine, mild citrus.  The finish is sharp.
Excellent beer.

How cool is the label on this bottle ??
The beer pours nice and black.  The medium brown head fades fairly quickly.  The aroma is only slightly coffee, the roasty malt is most notable. 
The beer is medium bodied, which is nice for a stout on a warm day.  If this was the dead of winter... I would be wishing it was heavier.  The flavor is mild coffee, roasted malts and a touch of finishing sweet something.  Very nice.

Nice deep mahogany pour.  A small off white head.  The aroma deep and almost, but not quite, caramel malts.  The beer has a decent sized body.  The flavor is full, and the whole tongue knows when the beer enters and leaves the mouth.  Very nice.  I hope they bring this one back next year.

First let me say that this is not one of my favorite styles.  It was in a sampler pack, so I will rate it.  The pour is golden with a constant stream of small bubbles and a small ring of white bubbles for a head.  The aroma is syrupy sweet perfumey.  The beer is almost medium bodied, the sweet and perfume are not as bold in the flavor as aroma.  The finish is a almost wheat crisp.  An ok beer,  Probably one of the better of this style... Still not my favorite.

Craft beer out of a can, I had feared a tin/metallic flavor.... But that was not the case at all.  
The beer is not as hoppy as many IPAs that are available.  But it is pleasant and drinkable.
The pour is bright orange, with a medium off white head.  
Aroma is surprisingly subtle for an IPA.  The pine and citrus flavors are lighter than expected, but on par with what the aroma promised.
Very drinkable.

Out of a can.  The pour is orange, with a medium white head.  The aroma is fruity, citrus, with some malty overtones.  the flavor is very true to the aroma.  The bitterness, comes with the piney hop flavors.  The body is on the lighter side of medium.  The carbonation is a bit on the high side.  Pretty good beer.

Nice black pour with a medium brown head.  The aroma is floral roasted malts.   This is a nice big stout, you can taste the high alcohol.  The roast is almost like a deep french roast coffee.  The finish is slow, but clean.  An Excellent stout.
beer_name: Sierra Nevada 30th Anniversary Fritz & Kens Ale

review_blob: The pour is nice amber color with a small off white head.  The aroma is banana, citrus and clove.  The beer tastes close to the aroma, the banana is almost missing, and the hops are not sharp but enjoyable.  This is an interesting beer.  I may get it again, but if I dont I will be Ok.

First let me say... I really like brown ales.
This pours deep deep mahogany brown, with a small red-hued foamy head.  The aroma is sweet malts and caramel.  The taste has more fruity hops than I would expect.  the roaty malts are strong and take control of the flavor shortly after the hop surprise.   The finish is fairly sharp for a beer of this body.  A very enjoyable nut brown.

Again in the can.  Pours as black as any stout or porter I would claim to be good.  small to medium tan-hued head.  Aroma is sweet toffee and toasted malts.  The flavor is very well balanced, the hops are sharp with their pine and citrus highlights.  The malts are robust and toasty.  The body is medium, which fits very nice to the flavor.  The only knock I have on this beer.... I swear there is a metallic taste to the beer.... From the can or from my head.... Still a good beer.

From a can.  Pours orange-amber with smaller off white head.  The aroma is solid pine from hop that I expect from an IPA.  The flavor is not has sharp and piney as the aroma leads you to expect.  It is sweet, the citrus notes are sloppy and large.  the finish is good and quick.  I was glad that there was no metallic taste.  An oK ipa.
beer_name: 21st Amendment Brew Free or Die IPA

review_blob: I am a brown ales.  Samuel Smiths is a brewer that makes fantastic beers.  But I was not as impressed with this as I had hoped I would be.  The beer pours a amber hued brown, with a medium sized off white head.  The aroma mild hop some apple cider notes.  The beer is crisp light er bodied than I like.  the finish is sharp and clean.  But the beer overall was OK.

Dead Reckoning pours deep dark mahogany, not black but still dark.  The head is small and the color of milky coffee.  The aroma is sweet roasted malts, with some caramel highlights.  The body is thinner than I like in a porter, and the flavor lingers with a long slow finish.  There are some smokey notes, goes nice with the roasted malts.  Pretty decent beer.

beer_brewer_name: Magic Hat Brewing Company (North American Breweries)
review_blob: Pour is orange hued amber with a small ring of white bubbles for a head.  The aroma is rye and hops, with sweet malt overtones.  Flavor is strong at the start of caramel malts, then the hops seem to take over, but they dim and under bitter.  There is a sharp grain, the rye??, in the finish.  It is OK.  From the packaging and the fact that is read HEX:Ourtoberfest"  I was really hoping for Oktoberfest.  An OK beer.

The Pour is orange-ish straw color with a small ring of off white bubbles for a head.  The aroma is slightly roasted malts.  The flavor is dominated by the roasted malts, the body is a light to medium.  The beer overall is fairly light.  It finishes without any fan fare.  Easy to drink.

This beer pours hazy golden amber. The very small head consists of fine bubbles that linger for the duration of the whole beer.  The aroma is of sweet floral hops.   The taste starts with the hops, sharp and bitter.  The taste of the hops lingers, there is some citrus in the aftertaste.  The finish is almost sharp, but the syrupy character lingers.  This is not as full bodied as I had expected it to be, making it a good beer for when you are looking to have one to three.
beer_name: Great Lakes Lake Erie Monster Imperial IPA

review_blob: The beer pours deep orange hued mahogany.  The head s small sudsy and yellow.  The aroma is syupry sweet, honey and fruit.  Many many small bubble rush to the top, I hope this is not too carbonated.  The flavor is very robust big hop, citrus and pine.  The Big malts are matched with big caramel malts.  the finish is not completely dry/sharp, but for the beers character it is pretty clean.  The high alcohol is masked almost completely.  Very good.

This beer pours nice and golden yellow, almost orange hued, with a big sudsie head.  A constant stream of bubbles in side the glass make me think this is a highly carbonated beer.  The aroma is nice and hoppy with some sweet floral/perfumy notes.  The beer is stronger than the aroma leads you expect, but the flavors are true to the aroma, the bitterness is eye opening.   The malts are big and bold, matching up very nicely with the big hop.  The finish is surprisingly sharp, but there lingers a bit of flowers

The mustard seeds in the area seem to have these hiding in the back of their beer cases.  Yesterday I did the dark today it is the light.
 The aroma on this beer is like fruity light soda, mostly raspberry. The pour is pale, almost a orange hued champagne color.
The hops and malts are very mild, to mild even.  The flavor is mostly light fruit and carbonation.
Due to the body is light and high carbonation, the finish was fast.
This is not my usual style of beer.  The light beer drinkers and fans of fruity wines might like this alot.

The mustard seeds in the area seem to have these hiding in the back of their beer cases.  
The aroma on this beer is strong, and strikingly similar to Framboise Lambic.  Raspberry and black berry dominate the aroma.  The pour is deep dark brown, with a medium light tan head.   I had expected the beer to be super sweet based on the aroma, but the hops, and sweet malts are very present and make the beer very enjoyable.  The beer finishes pretty fast, but not clean.  The body is light and very very carbonated.  
Over all, Im not a big fan of fruit beers, but this is pretty good.  In my humble opinion, if it had less carbonation, it would be a much better beer.
